revised_title: Monthly Mean Temperatures of Thames Water and Atmospheric Temperatures at the Royal Observatory
tldr: This article presents a study of the monthly mean temperatures of the River Thames water and the atmospheric temperatures at the Royal Observatory in Greenwich. The author compares the mean temperature of the water to that of the air and discusses the factors affecting the temperature changes. The study reveals that the mean temperature of the water is higher than the air temperature, with the greatest difference occurring in October and the least in February. The author concludes that the water at Greenwich is not significantly affected by the tides.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Climate Science
